meanings.definition: Umping (verb): the act of serving as an umpire in a sports game
meanings.sent1: During the baseball game, John was umping to make fair calls.
meanings.sent2: The referee was umping the soccer match with precision and fairness.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was umping when it tried to referee the mice race.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to umping between the two teams was like a beacon of fairness.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the whistle echoed through the stadium as she began umping.

meanings.definition: Umping (noun): the role or position of an umpire in a sports game
meanings.sent1: Being in the umping role requires a good understanding of the game.
meanings.sent2: The importance of the umping position is evident in every match.
meanings.sent3: The dog proudly wore a hat, pretending it was in the umping role.
meanings.sent4: In the chess game of life, she played the umping role with wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The young boy dreamt of one day taking on the prestigious umping position.
